page.title: 15Macclesfield Canal.
page.content: The{Macclesfield Canal}runs through our area.It carries mostly holiday boats now, although it was built to serve the many mills that sprang up during the Industrial Revolution.It links up the Midlands and the Cheshire ring.There are no locks on it, but there are rows of bridges which are numbered.The canal passes through {High Lane and Poynton}where there is a Marina.The tow paths are in quite good condition and it is possible to walk along them without getting too muddy. There is plenty to look at as you walk alongside the canal.Blackberries are growing and there are many different kinds of plants and flowers to enjoy. There are fish in the canals as well as smalll mammals like water voles.
